title: How to Make S'mores Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and spray nonstick cooking spray on an 8" by 8" (20 cm by 20 cm) baking pan.
Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat them on medium speed using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
Add the egg and the vanilla and continue beating the wet ingredients for about 5 minutes or until they are light and fluffy.
Turn the mixer down to low speed and add the flour, graham cracker crumbs, baking powder and kosher salt.
steps.description: Mix at low speed for about 2-1/2 minutes or until the dry ingredients are well combined with the wet ingredients.

steps.headline: Press 1/2 of the dough into the bottom of the pre-greased baking pan.
Lay the milk chocolate bars on top of the dough.
Spread marshmallow fluff over the top of the chocolate bars.
steps.description: Make sure that the chocolate layer is not more than 1/4" (6 millimeters) thick.

steps.headline: Scoop tablespoons of the remaining dough onto a work surface and flatten them with either your clean hands or with the bottom of a glass.
steps.description: Place the flattened discs of dough on top of the marshmallow fluff until you have completely covered the top.

steps.headline: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes.
steps.description: Then, remove the s'mores cookies from the oven and cool them completely on the stovetop before you slice them into bars with a knife.

text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and spray nonstick cooking spray on an 8" by 8" (20 cm by 20 cm) baking pan.  Place the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat them on medium speed using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.  Add the egg and the vanilla and continue beating the wet ingredients for about 5 minutes or until they are light and fluffy.  Turn the mixer down to low speed and add the flour, graham cracker crumbs, baking powder and kosher salt. Mix at low speed for about 2-1/2 minutes or until the dry ingredients are well combined with the wet ingredients. Press 1/2 of the dough into the bottom of the pre-greased baking pan.  Lay the milk chocolate bars on top of the dough.  Spread marshmallow fluff over the top of the chocolate bars. Make sure that the chocolate layer is not more than 1/4" (6 millimeters) thick. Scoop tablespoons of the remaining dough onto a work surface and flatten them with either your clean hands or with the bottom of a glass. Place the flattened discs of dough on top of the marshmallow fluff until you have completely covered the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Then, remove the s'mores cookies from the oven and cool them completely on the stovetop before you slice them into bars with a knife. Finished.
